billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Requires a revenue distribution agreement for equitable allocation within the county of Suffolk for public safety purposes of sales and compensating use taxes
summary: Requires a revenue distribution agreement for equitable allocation within the county of Suffolk for public safety purposes of sales and compensating use taxes.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

           S. 2638                                                  A. 3735

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                             S E N A T E - A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 27, 2011
                                      ___________

       IN SENATE -- Introduced by Sen. LAVALLE -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed,  and  when  printed  to  be committed to the Committee on Investi-
         gations and Government Operations

       IN ASSEMBLY -- Introduced by M. of A. THIELE -- read once  and  referred
         to the Committee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to requiring a revenue distrib-
         ution  agreement for equitable allocation within the county of Suffolk
         for public safety purposes of sales and compensating use tax

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  (c)  of  section  1262-j  of the tax law, as
    2  amended by chapter 283 of the laws  of  2009,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    (c)  Notwithstanding  any provision of law to the contrary, of the net
    5  collections received by the  county  of  Suffolk  as  a  result  of  the
    6  increase  of one percent to the tax authorized by section twelve hundred
    7  ten of this article for the period beginning June  first,  two  thousand
    8  one  and  ending  November  thirtieth,  two  thousand [eleven] THIRTEEN,
    9  imposed by local laws or resolutions (by simple majority) by the  county
   10  legislature,  and  signed by the county executive, the county of Suffolk
   11  shall allocate such net collections as follows: no less than  one-eighth
   12  and no more than three-eighths of such net collections received shall be
   13  dedicated  for public safety purposes and the balance shall be deposited
   14  in the general fund of the  county  of  Suffolk.    COMMENCING  DECEMBER
   15  FIRST,  TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN, THE NET COLLECTIONS RECEIVED THAT ARE DEDI-
   16  CATED TO PUBLIC SAFETY PURPOSES FROM THE ADDITIONAL RATES IMPOSED PURSU-
   17  ANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE DEPOSITED IN A SPECIAL FUND TO  BE  CREATED
   18  BY  SUCH  COUNTY SEPARATE AND APART FROM ANY OTHER FUNDS AND ACCOUNTS OF
   19  THE COUNTY TO BE USED FOR GENERAL FUND PURPOSES. IF THE COUNTY ALLOCATES
   20  MONIES FROM SUCH SPECIAL FUND FOR PROPERTY TAX STABILIZATION AND  RELIEF

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03796-01-1

       S. 2638                             2                            A. 3735

    1  TO  THE  SUFFOLK  COUNTY POLICE DISTRICT, THEN THE COUNTY SHALL ALLOCATE
    2  MONIES TO THE TOWNS AND VILLAGES WHICH ARE NOT PART OF THE SUFFOLK COUN-
    3  TY  POLICE  DISTRICT  IN  ORDER   TO   ENSURE   EQUITABLE   DISTRIBUTION
    4  COUNTY-WIDE.  THE  ALLOCATIONS FROM THE SPECIAL FUND CREATED PURSUANT TO
    5  THIS SECTION SHALL  BE  SUBJECT  TO  A  REVENUE  DISTRIBUTION  AGREEMENT
    6  ENTERED  INTO  PURSUANT  TO  THE AUTHORITY OF SUBDIVISION (C) OF SECTION
    7  TWELVE HUNDRED SIXTY-TWO OF THIS PART IN ORDER TO  ENSURE  PROPERTY  TAX
    8  RELIEF  ON A COUNTY-WIDE BASIS. THE REVENUE DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT SHALL
    9  BE CODIFIED IN THE COUNTY CHARTER AND REMAIN IN EFFECT AS LONG  AS  SUCH
   10  SALES  AND COMPENSATING USE TAX COMPONENT IS IN EFFECT, OR ANY SUCCESSOR
   11  COMPONENT, FOR SUCH PUBLIC SAFETY PURPOSES. THE AMOUNTS TO BE  ALLOCATED
   12  IN  REDUCTION  OF  THE  SUFFOLK  COUNTY POLICE DISTRICT TAXES AND TO THE
   13  TOWNS AND VILLAGES WHICH ARE NOT  PART  OF  THE  SUFFOLK  COUNTY  POLICE
   14  DISTRICT  SHALL BE DETERMINED ON EITHER: (1) THE BASIS OF THE RESPECTIVE
   15  POPULATIONS OF THE SEVERAL TOWNS AND VILLAGES IN SUCH COUNTY, DETERMINED
   16  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE  LATEST  FEDERAL  CENSUS  OR  SPECIAL  POPULATION
   17  CENSUS  TAKEN  PURSUANT  TO SECTION TWENTY OF THE GENERAL MUNICIPAL LAW,
   18  COMPLETED AND PUBLISHED PRIOR TO THE END OF THE QUARTER  FOR  WHICH  THE
   19  ALLOCATION  IS  MADE,  WHICH  SPECIAL POPULATION MUST INCLUDE THE ENTIRE
   20  AREA OF THE COUNTY; OR (2) THE BASIS OF THE NINETEEN HUNDRED NINETY-FOUR
   21  AMOUNTS ALLOCATED AND UNIFORMLY INCREASING IN PROPORTIONALITY ACROSS THE
   22  COUNTY AND TAKING INTO ACCOUNT ANY SUCCESSOR COMPONENT FOR THE SALES AND
   23  COMPENSATING USE TAX, NOTWITHSTANDING ANY YEAR OF  INEQUITABLE  DISTRIB-
   24  UTION  BY  THE  COUNTY  OF  SUFFOLK TO TOWNS AND VILLAGES OUTSIDE OF THE
   25  SUFFOLK COUNTY POLICE DISTRICT. HOWEVER, IF THE COUNTY ALLOCATES  MONIES
   26  FROM  SUCH  SPECIAL  FUND DIRECTLY TO THE GENERAL FUND TO REDUCE THE TAX
   27  LEVY FOR COUNTY-WIDE PUBLIC SAFETY PURPOSES, THE CORRESPONDING  PROPERTY
   28  TAX  RELIEF  IS PROVIDED ON A COUNTY-WIDE BASIS AND ON THE BASIS OF FULL
   29  VALUATION OF REAL PROPERTY AND NO FURTHER REVENUE DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT
   30  IS REQUIRED.
   31    S 2. This act  shall  take  effect  immediately  with  allocation  and
   32  distributions  of  net collections to be proposed within the 2011 budget
   33  of the county of Suffolk.
